Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Claire>
Entry.EnglishText: <Claire>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Tytree>
Entry.EnglishText: <Tytree>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Hilda>
Entry.EnglishText: <Hilda>

Entry.JapaneseText: 行商人
Entry.EnglishText: Peddler

Entry.JapaneseText: notice
Entry.EnglishText: Notice

Entry.JapaneseText: 熱き窯戸の職人
Entry.EnglishText: Potter

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: キョグエン近郊の小屋
Entry.EnglishText: Kyogen Hostel

Entry.JapaneseText: キョグエン近郊の小屋
Entry.EnglishText: Kyogen Hostel

Entry.JapaneseText: <Claire>!!
Entry.EnglishText: <Claire>!

Entry.JapaneseText: ケガはないか!?
Entry.EnglishText: Are you hurt?

Entry.JapaneseText: ええ……大丈夫……
Entry.EnglishText: No... I'm fine.

Entry.JapaneseText: ひとりだけか？
Entry.EnglishText: Are you the only one here?

Entry.JapaneseText: えっ……？
Entry.EnglishText: What...?

Entry.JapaneseText: おまえの他にも、 盗賊にさらわれた人が いるんじゃないのか？
Entry.EnglishText: We were told that there was another girl who was kidnapped alongside you.

Entry.JapaneseText: 私以外に……？
Entry.EnglishText: Another girl...?

Entry.JapaneseText: おまえが捕えられていた部屋の隣にも 誰かひとりいたと、おまえと一緒に 捕えられていた娘が言っていたが……
Entry.EnglishText: One of the other girls you were locked up with said that there was someone in the room next to yours.

Entry.JapaneseText: 一緒に捕えられていた娘……？
Entry.EnglishText: The girls locked up with me...?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……とにかくさらわれたのは、 おまえひとりだけなんだな？
Entry.EnglishText: ...So it really was just you who was kidnapped?
Y-Yes...

Entry.JapaneseText: よかった……無事で……
Entry.EnglishText: Thank goodness you're safe...

Entry.JapaneseText: それにしてもワン・ギンの野郎…… クレアさんをかどわかそうとする なんてよ！ とっちめてやろうぜ！
Entry.EnglishText: That Wang Gin jerk... He has some nerve locking Claire up like that! I'm going to rake him over the coals!

Entry.JapaneseText: <Cyan>幻の庭<White>の事も 聞かせてもらうわ。 もちろん、無料でね。
Entry.EnglishText: He still needs to tell us about the <Cyan>Garden of Illusions<White>. Free of charge, of course.

Entry.JapaneseText: 君か……この本、すごいよ！ 本を読んだら旅を続けたくなって ここまで来ちゃったんだ！
Entry.EnglishText: You there...this book is amazing! It taught me everything I know and got me to where I am today.

Entry.JapaneseText: 冒険を体験した人間が読むと、 行間に込められた緊迫感まで 感じることができるんだね！
Entry.EnglishText: The suspense, the adventure, the excitement and reading between the lines you can really feel the sense of urgency and determination!

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>『冒険小説』を回収しました。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>You got back the Adventure Novel.

Entry.JapaneseText: とっても勉強になったよ。 これ、僕の授業料だから 受け取って！
Entry.EnglishText: This book had taught me quite a bit. Consider it as a free gift for you!

Entry.JapaneseText: さあ！ 冒険を続けるぞ!!
Entry.EnglishText: Come on! Let's keep this adventure going!

Entry.JapaneseText: よし！ じゅうぶん休んだから そろそろ出発するか!!
Entry.EnglishText: Alright, we've tarried long enough. It is time for the journey to continue!

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ、なんてうるさい音なんだ…… これじゃ、新しいツボなんて、 作れないよ……！
Entry.EnglishText: My, what was that awful sound... How am I supposed to make any new pottery with such a racket...!

Entry.JapaneseText: 素晴らしい粉をありがとう。 これで新しいツボを焼いてみるよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Thank you for this great powder. I'll be able to fire up something great with this.

Entry.JapaneseText: サファイア粉末、エメラルド粉末、 カレー粉、片栗粉……どの粉も違う。 どうしてもあの色が出ない……
Entry.EnglishText: Sapphire powder, emerald power, curry powder, potato starch... none of them worked. I just can't get the right color...

Entry.JapaneseText: 夢に見たあのツボ…… 私の理想の色を出せる奇跡の粉が、 どこかにないものか……
Entry.EnglishText: The pot of my dreams... I wonder if there is a miracle powder somewhere that will produce my ideal color...

Entry.JapaneseText: おっ、キミは珍しい粉を 持っているようだね。 いくらか私に分けてもらえないか？
Entry.EnglishText: Wow, that is a mighty fine and rare powder you have there. Would you be willing to share some with me?

Entry.JapaneseText: もちろんタダでとは言わない。 お礼はさせてもらうよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Of course, I'm not asking you to part with it for free. I am happy to return the favor.

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ、キミたち。 このあいだはありがとう。 おかげでいい色のツボが焼けたよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Oh, it is you. Thank you for your kindness earlier. Thanks to you, I was able to achieve a great colored pot.

Entry.JapaneseText: おっ、また珍しい粉を 持っているようだね。 いくらか私に分けてもらえないか？
Entry.EnglishText: Oh, it seems you have another rare powder. Would you be willing to share some of it with me?

Entry.JapaneseText: またいい粉があったら、 教えてくれよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Let me know if you come across any more rare powders.

Entry.JapaneseText: 珍しい粉を求めて、 旅に出ようかなって 考えてるんだよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I am thinking of going on a journey in search of some rare powders.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>分けてあげますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Will you hand some over? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: フレアパウダー
Entry.EnglishText: Flare Powder

Entry.JapaneseText: <Red> フレアパウダー <color:80000000>
Entry.EnglishText: <Red>Flare Powder<color:80000000>

Entry.JapaneseText: アクアパウダー
Entry.EnglishText: Aqua Powder

Entry.JapaneseText: <Red> アクアパウダー <color:80000000>
Entry.EnglishText: <Red>Aqua Powder<color:80000000>

Entry.JapaneseText: ゲイルパウダー
Entry.EnglishText: Gale Powder

Entry.JapaneseText: <Red> ゲイルパウダー <color:80000000>
Entry.EnglishText: <Red>Gale Powder<color:80000000>

Entry.JapaneseText: アースパウダー
Entry.EnglishText: Earth Powder

Entry.JapaneseText: <Red> アースパウダー <color:80000000>
Entry.EnglishText: <Red>Earth Powder<color:80000000>

Entry.JapaneseText: ライトパウダー
Entry.EnglishText: Light Powder

Entry.JapaneseText: <Red> ライトパウダー <color:80000000>
Entry.EnglishText: <Red>Light Powder<color:80000000>

Entry.JapaneseText: ダークパウダー
Entry.EnglishText: Dark Powder

Entry.JapaneseText: <Red> ダークパウダー <color:80000000>
Entry.EnglishText: <Red>Dark Powder<color:80000000>
<speed:0><scale:140>What will you hand over? <unk18:48D00480> <unk18:48D40480> <unk18:48D80480> <unk18:48DC0480> <unk18:48E00480> <unk18:48E40480> Hand over nothing.

Entry.JapaneseText: よっし！ これで素晴らしいツボを 焼いてみせるぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: Wonderful! I am sure I can fire up a great beauty with this.

Entry.JapaneseText: これをやるよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Here we go.

Entry.JapaneseText: また素晴らしいツボを 焼いてみせるぞ！
Entry.EnglishText: I'm going to fire up something great with this!

Entry.JapaneseText: そうだ、 お礼にこれをやるよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I almost forgot, please take this as a token of my thanks.

Entry.JapaneseText: 素晴らしい粉が…… 欲しい……
Entry.EnglishText: The elusive great powder... I will find you one day...

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>あなたはフレアパウダーを 持っていません。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>You currently do not have any Flare Powder.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>あなたはアクアパウダーを 持っていません。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>You currently do not have any Aqua Powder.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>あなたはゲイルパウダーを 持っていません。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>You currently do not have any Gale Powder.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>あなたはアースパウダーを 持っていません。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>You currently do not have any Earth Powder.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>あなたはライトパウダーを 持っていません。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>You currently do not have any Light Powder.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>あなたはダークパウダーを 持っていません。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>You currently do not have any Dark Powder.

Entry.JapaneseText: そっか……？ ああ……どこかに いい粉を分けてくれる 親切な人はいないもんだろうか……
Entry.EnglishText: I see... If only there was a kind soul over there who could find and share some rare powders...

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『ツボ焼き窯』 中でいくつかのツボが焼かれている。 火加減ひとつで焼きあがりが変わるので 焼き始めたら窯から離れられない。 炎を見つめていると、不思議とやる気が わいて来る。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Clay Pot Kiln - A number of ceramic items are currently being baked within the kiln. The quality of the final product is heat dependent, requiring a diligent eye. Gazing at the flames fills you with determination.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『ツボ作り用の粘土』 アルヴァン山脈の断層から 切り出した白粘土と、 ツルベナ荒野の地下から 掘り出した赤粘土。 こだわりの土。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>-The Origin of Specific Clay- Certain colors of clay are only found in specific locations. For example, white clay is mined from fault lines along the Alvan Mountain ranges while red clay can only be mined from beneath the Crvena Wastelands.
Entry.Notes: Clay is usually mined or gathered. Given the verbs used, I chose to use the word "mined."

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『ろくろとツボ』 作りかけのまま、乾燥してしまったツボ。 考え事を始めてしまうと、今まで自分が やっていた事を忘れてしまう職人は多い。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>-A Half-Sculpted Pot- A piece of clay that has dried up mid sculpt. Many artisans forget about their current task once they begin to get lost in their thoughts.
Entry.Notes: The original Japanese has "a potter's wheel pot," but I changed the title to match the description of the item. Feel free to edit the title.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『ツボ着彩セット』 市販品を混ぜた着色材料や、 独自に調合したものが並んでいる。 ヘラやすり鉢も自作の品。 こだわりの品ぞろい。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>-Ceramic Coloring Tools- Commercially available products are intermingled with non-traditional, self-made products. Various tools also appear to be homemade. It's clear that great care was taken when gathering these tools.
Entry.Notes: The original Japanses ends the title with 'set.' Tools is probably more appropriate in this context.
